website_summaries.verdict: Wacom's smooth, elegant stylus for capacitive tablets is one of the best we've seen, and adding a pen to the end only makes it more useful: just be prepared to pay an extra 10 dollars for the privilege.
pros: The Wacom Bamboo Stylus duo has pen and stylus features in a comfortable, weighted barrel
ink cartridges are easily replaced, and the stylus tip feels silky-smooth
cons: The pen cap needs to be on the back of the stylus to really feel good in the hand as a pen
$40 might be too much for some to pay

customer_reviews.title: Great stylus
customer_reviews.text: This is a great stylus for the price. I have used it for about a year and a half and only used two tips. I am currently in school full time and I take notes on my IPad Air 2. The stylus is smooth and easy to use. For the price and quality, it cannot be beaten. I would definitely recommend this product. Also, do not buy the cheaper stylus tips on Amazon. They are significantly thinner material and do not last as long as the Bamboo branded ones.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Not up to Wacom standards
customer_reviews.text: Not what I had imagined for a portable stylus, and that's more on me for purchasing the wrong device. I wanted a pen that I could attach to my phone and carry around; this pen is much thicker, and clearly made for home/desk use. The part that makes me scratch my head is that for a pen, it's very inaccurate. While that applies to most capacitive touch pens, a Wacom tablet is known for pen accuracy. I've owned Graphire 3 & 4 tablets, and still love my widescreen Intuos3. Why then, would Wacom make a pen that has such flex in the tip that drawing is so difficult?
customer_reviews.author: M. Medeiros

customer_reviews.title: Very useful stylus and pen
customer_reviews.text: Most devices don't recognize my finger. Even the copy machine at work doesn't response to my fingers. This stylus and pen is a live saver. I can use it on my iPhone, the copy machine at work and other devices. I use it to sign my signature on a tablet. And from time to time, I have need for a simple ball point pen.
customer_reviews.author: GeeWiz

customer_reviews.title: Not fancy and not for artists but fun for phone art apps and taking notes.
customer_reviews.text: This stylus does not provide pressure sensitivity. Don't get it for that purpose. However, it is very useful as a phone stylus that will be extremely compact and will not scratch the screen. It does not require batteries. I like it except for the holder cap you place in the audio jack, because it's a short tether and I see no need for it. It comes with some red and blue rim rings to make it more colorful, too, if you actually care about such a small form of customization. Anyway, this is a great travel stylus for the price ($5), but if you want something suave or fancy-looking, spend a few extra dollars for one of Wacom's other styluses.
customer_reviews.author: SyrslyTwitch

customer_reviews.title: Overhyped
customer_reviews.text: I paid the money for this thinking it would be better somehow than the countless other options available on amazon. This stylus is nothing special and I was disappointed to find that the stylus expands to the finished height in the picture and does not lock in place, causing it to get shorter if you apply pressure to it the wrong way. Save your cash and buy the amazon stylus.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product, Great Resolution
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a fairly low cost, especially compared to other stylus options on the market. I was amazed at the compactness, which is cool that it extends and collapses, as well as it's precision. It's pretty close to writing with a regular pen. I was skeptical the responsiveness and thinness of the line was going to be lacking, but it's not at all! I like to sketch very detailed on my tablet and this stylus is great for that, and travels easily due to it's size and the option to hook it in to your headphone jack on the tablet. Also protects the tip to help make it last longer.
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: Not intuitive to movement, requires a lot of effort to use, not worth it.
customer_reviews.text: I've used Wacom products for most of my career. I love their tablets and had heard good things about their stylus' for iPad. This really fails to deliver. The brush strokes are inconsistent at best. It skips unless you are pressing extremely hard with the stylus. As an artist we train our hand to give lighter strokes and to work quickly, and this stylus does not facilitate that. I bought a stylus/pen combo through Polaroid. It registers quick strokes and doesn't require me to press to an extreme to get a consistent mark. I'd recommend the $3 stylus over this one any day.
customer_reviews.author: Miss

customer_reviews.title: Lag Time
customer_reviews.text: Pro's: Price point, Bamboo is made by Wacom (or I wouldn't have even bothered with it), clip seems sturdy, decorative color bands and a replacement nib included. Con's: On both my iPad 3rd generation and my iPad Mini 1st generation, when drawing I experience about a 2" lag time between the time I place the stylus on my screen and when the iPad finally realizes there is something there. I've tried different pressures and nib angles. Same with using the stylus on a keyboard. Takes a few tries to get the IOS keyboards to realize something is there. For the price ($9.24) I'll keep it.
customer_reviews.author: Susan S.

customer_reviews.title: Just kind of dumb
customer_reviews.text: I saw the Wacom name and thought that meant I would get quality. I like the 10 cent give away stylus I got at an education fair better than this one. It doesn't appear to be pressure sensitive at all and I feel like I have have to push too hard to write/draw naturally. It is kind of neat that it attaches to your device, but it is equally as strange to have it hanging from your device. I wasn't impressed. The purchase felt like a waste.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan

customer_reviews.title: Dual stylus that’s very sleek.
customer_reviews.text: This dual stylus is sleek and very durable. Very easy to use never seems to get sluggish and stops working. I recommend this product to use stylus. It’s a little pricey but it’s worth the quality.
customer_reviews.author: Denise T.

customer_reviews.title: Hesitates when beginning to write
customer_reviews.text: I've spent a lot of time testing styli trying to find the ideal stylus for use on my iPad and Android tablet. As it turns out, the humble cheap stylus is the best. I even downloaded Wacom's Bamboo app for my iPad and when I saw this stylus, I bought it, thinking it would work well on *THEIR* app, at the very least. The thing hesitates as I begin the first stroke of writing so my first letter is incomplete. As I continue writing, it is okay but when I pause and begin again, the hesitation shows up again. I guess the only reason I don't give it one star is because it does write, mostly.
customer_reviews.author: iphranque

customer_reviews.title: You want a D-1 ink refill.
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this stylus. It's well made, has perfect balance, feels great in my grip and writes well on my iPad. Along with my Bamboo Solo, it has the fastest writing speed of any stylus I've tried. It's also more precise than other conventional styli. I recently ran it through the wash by mistake and destroyed the ink cartridge. I had a heck of a time finding a replacement refill. Wacom didn't sell refills or identify what refills would work. After a lot of research, I discovered that the industry-standard D-1 refill is the one to use. It's a perfect fit. I ordered a 4-pack of refills from Amazon. They work perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Islander

customer_reviews.title: Very nice pen- except..
customer_reviews.text: Based on appearance and writing capability this is a very nice pen, if you keep it on your desk. Unfortunately, I like to keep mine with me, in my shirt pocket. The cap isn't tight enough and comes off, leaving the pen in the bottom of my pocket. I like the pen well enough that I bought a second pen with the hope that the issue was a freak with the first one. Unfortunately, the second did the same. So I'm looking for another pen. For this reason I gave it only 3 stars. If you want a pen/stylus for your desk, the Bamboo is a good one. However, if you intend to clip it in a pocket, look elsewhere,
customer_reviews.author: Roger

customer_reviews.title: Love. LOVE. LOVVVEEE it.
customer_reviews.text: I bought one of those cheapy dollar for 3 stylus sets on Amazon.... and it was a massive flop. I'll admit it... I was avoiding paying this much for a stylus because I didn't see the point.... well.... let me tell you, save the money you'd spend buying something cheaper that will fail... and just buy this. This stylus is amazing. The weight is nice, it's extremely responsive.... it's really been a wonderful purchase... and if you're someone like me who's been on the fence... just get it, you won't be sorry... you can use it on everything from your iPad to your Nook to your phone... it's wonderful.
customer_reviews.author: Lila Louise

customer_reviews.title: The Best I Found
customer_reviews.text: The Bamboo brand expandable stylus with a narrow replaceable nib is great for my iPod Touch 5g. The Bamboo Stylus is well made, has a nice rubber finger grip that is a big help when writing and it is the most expensive one I have yet found on today's market. I like the size and heft of it, but it may be a bit bulky for some people. It is one of the few styli available with a replaceable nib and those nibs are available in firm or soft densities. This is a very nice stylus and even with the high price tag I can recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Richard L. Steiner

customer_reviews.title: Okay, but not great (the knockoff version)
customer_reviews.text: This model really isn't as sturdy as the original Bamboo stylus ("solo"). The cap doesn't stay secured to the pen end as much as you might expect, and the ink itself isn't anything special. The nib on the stylus isn't as easy to replace as on other models, as the base does not unscrew. It's good for what it is, but was expecting better. As a follow-up, after reading other reviews on here, mine appears to be a knockoff, like many others have reported---it has no serial number. Disappointed in Amazon and its affiliate seller, "SMART SHOP USA" for this.
customer_reviews.author: I. M. Melnick

customer_reviews.title: Good-quality stylus at an attractive price
customer_reviews.text: Nice little stylus, especially considering the bargain price ($9.99). Can be customized with two additional sets of coloured metal rings that are supplied (blue and red, in addition to the silver rings on it in the box). Dual-purpose cap also has a string with a rubber end that allows it to be inserted into the headphone port for safekeeping. Works well with my iPhone and iPad, and pleasantly surprised that it also works with my Surface Pro (although obviously, no right-click functionality). A little more heft would be nice, but not worth docking a star.
customer_reviews.author: David Gee

customer_reviews.title: Unlike my other Bamboo, this one poorly made
customer_reviews.text: I love my black Bamboo, it works great, but I desired a brightly colored one that could easily be found. This green one has a problem with the way the guts beneath the nib is constructed, not quite the same as the guts in my black Bamboo. This one, the nib does not protrude far enough, causing the metal sleeve to hit the screen with even a light touch. At first I thought the nib must have been put on wrong, but on closer inspection and comparing it to the black Bamboo, I could readily see that it was constructed differently. This one will be going back to the seller.
customer_reviews.author: Pilar

customer_reviews.title: Be very Careful
customer_reviews.text: I own a Wacom tablet and a Cintiq, both of which are outstanding products, and so I was expecting to find the Bamboo Solo Stylus to be of similar quality. Instead, I found it to be no better in many respects than similar products costing must less. The main problem that I found with the Bamboo is that the tip is housed in a metal nib, and with very little pressure when used at an angle, the metal comes into contact with the glass on my iPad. The risk of scratching the glass on my iPad is not one I am willing to take. Come on, Wacom engineers, you can do better than this.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Good but overpriced.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this after reading many good reviews about it. It's not a bad stylus, but not outstandingly great either. For this price I would expect something that performed much better than the ones I bought for less than a dollar a piece. I would not recommend this unless you want to overpay for an average writing utensil. I have used it on Nook Tablet, iPhone, iPad, and Nexus 7 and it worked fine on all of them. It works for drawing or writing, but not quite as good as the cheap ones I bought because the tip is so soft.
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: Great for keeping finger smears off the glass
customer_reviews.text: It is responsive, but not as responsive as a Wacom Tablet Pen. I use on IPhone and an IPad. I find myself putting down the pen when using the IPad, because of the multi finger gestures needed. Great on the Iphone, especially since I have large hands. I also find I prefer the hard tips to the soft tips. Tips are easy to replace FYI. I recommend this to anyone who has large hands or broad fingers and find smudges distracting. I own the combo with the pen, it is a little on the heavy side as another side note.
customer_reviews.author: L. Steven Hall

customer_reviews.title: I can stand smudged screens
customer_reviews.text: I use this just about every time I use my cell for texts or browsing. Much less smearing and dirty screens from using fingers. The cap is pretty unnecessary with a phone though...even with the minimum height, it's still big when hanging from your phone. If you use the cap, it's better with a tablet. I'll be getting some for family members. People are alway asking me where I got mine from.
customer_reviews.author: Jon Veteran

customer_reviews.title: Great,and does exactly as it's advertised!I love it!
customer_reviews.text: Love it for exactly what it is sold for a easy to carry on you and very comfortable handling stylus! I also have the 4th generation stylus regular size but it's just as good and is awesome for at home work and every use in which you other wise would have to use your fingers, but it makes things like when the wheel was discovered as in comparison to use on touchscreen technology, lol!
customer_reviews.author: k taylor

customer_reviews.title: Better off buying the Solo or Duo Stylus.
customer_reviews.text: I honestly wouldn't recommend this over the Bamboo Solo or Duo styluses -- it doesn't save that much room, and the sliding movement is starting to wear out in less than a year -- the silicone grip is a nice addition that the Solo and Duo don't have, but even that is starting to get slack like an old rubberband over time. I still think Bamboo makes the absolute best capacitive styluses, but I think this one is a dud.
customer_reviews.author: A. Richards

customer_reviews.title: Great Portable Size Stylus
customer_reviews.text: I believe this is the best stylus you can purchase reasons why are replaceable nibs&compact size with cap.Here is a tip:I pulled open the string on the cap threaded my headphone jack through it & plugged in my headphones back into my iPad. Reason for 4 stars-instructions did not state there are 2 different size same colored rings and one will only fit on the top and the other on the bottom.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the cost
customer_reviews.text: I spent the extra because Wacom has such great products, but this stylus is a big disappointment. The thing that I really am unhappy with is the nib. I purchased on April 15 and it's already torn and I'm just an average user (not taking a lot of notes or drawing that often). I started looking for replacement nibs to find that they cost more via Amazon ($20 for 3) than Wacom, but Wacom is always out of stock. I'm replacing this with a much cheaper stylus recommended by a coworker (the Acase stylus cost less than one replacement nib for Bamboo's stylus). Don't waste you money.
customer_reviews.author: Sue Britton

customer_reviews.title: Bunk w/ Otterbox screen protectors
customer_reviews.text: Bunk, I bought this stylus based on all the reviews and it works horribly with the Otterbox screen protectors. Thankfully the soft tip worked better than the firm tip but even then, I could still write better with my finger so this is going back. I'm sure it would work good with a generic screen protector but if you have an Otterbox case or something similar, forget it.
customer_reviews.author: R. Reyes

customer_reviews.title: Delay in "output"
customer_reviews.text: This may just be my unit or a fluke but there seems to be a delay in the output of whatever I'm drawing. The paint stroke appears about an 1/8 inch behind where the stylus is touching the tablet and where I'm completing my stroke. Does that make sense? I've tried to replicate this experience with a stylus by lunatik and didn't have the same issue. I see a lot of high ratings so this may just be the unit I have. My experience is with a retina iPad mini.
customer_reviews.author: amazing

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Size & Weight
customer_reviews.text: I love this stylus! I use it for taking notes on GoodNotes on my iPad. I have never used it for sketching, so I'm unsure how it'd work for that use. I like that the pen cap is not in the way when using the stylus. Other cheaper and smaller stylus I've used the pen clip has been in the way. The nubs are great. I've been using it for a couple months now without issue. There was a tiny crack in the nub when it arrived, but it doesn't affect its use. I really like the weight of the stylus.
customer_reviews.author: Crystal C

customer_reviews.title: works great.
customer_reviews.text: I use this stylus when using touch pads at the atm, gas stations or stores. It telescopes very small so it can fit in your pocket very easily and has a cap to keep the tip covered after touching various screens.
customer_reviews.author: Darren Kimura

customer_reviews.title: Meh
customer_reviews.text: The stylus works fine but there are two drawbacks for me. I wants to tuck this pen into the stylus loop on my iPad case but unfortunately the clip, which is needed to hold it in place (it's not an elastic loop) is attached to the cap for the duo (covering the pen) which is not secure at all on the stylus causing it to fall off way too easily. I am expecting to lose this stylus if I accidentally leave it in the loop when I leave the house. Will look for a stylus with a better secured cap for the pen.
customer_reviews.author: User

customer_reviews.title: Like the way the stylus can be personalized with the ...
customer_reviews.text: Double "Like". Like the way the stylus can be personalized with the supplied choice of colored rings. Like the ability to collapse the stylus, quickly toss in my pocket and easily carry around. As a result of the latter, it has gone through the wash at least twice and still works like new. Tried using the keeper that plugs into the jack on the cell phone. It is okay, but for my phone use/carry method, not reliable to keep the stylus secured to the phone. This, in my opinion, does not take away from the quality of the instrument.
customer_reviews.author: Da Kine

customer_reviews.title: My husband loves it; just what he wanted.
customer_reviews.text: My husband used his iPad religiously for taking notes, whether it be in a business meeting or while planning his weekend tasks. He was getting frustrated with the stylus he had because the tip was too soft and didn't keep up with his writing speed. He found this one on Amazon which included the pen option and he couldn't be more thrilled! Now he can takes notes in meetings and sign documents with the same tool! Very pleased with the quality of this item. The craftsmanship is excellent.
customer_reviews.author: MOM2JTV

customer_reviews.title: Counterfeit
customer_reviews.text: Purchased my first duo to find out it was counterfeit. Wacom confirmed it for me but only to tell me to take it up with amazon. Amazon refunded me and placed another order for me which was, ALSO counterfeit. So after all that I ended up having to return both for refunds and am left 3 weeks later with no stylus. Would have been nice if Wacom replaced so I could try out the real product but after all this it looks like I will be switching to another stylus.
customer_reviews.author: durds

customer_reviews.title: Good but not great
customer_reviews.text: Bamboo makes the best stylus I have used especially when using one of the note taking apps such as Noteability. The advantage is in the nib, the bamboo nibs glide and flow better than the regular off the shelf brands. The same is true of this unit and I thought I would appreciate the collapsing feature however it does not lock or have enough friction to remain in either position when in use and tends to move or change position causing a minor distraction. I simply prefer the fixed size bamboo stylus. I also thought the attachment clip would be handy but it requires more effort than it should to remove the cap from the pen.
customer_reviews.author: Jbga

customer_reviews.title: Light colors get dirty fast
customer_reviews.text: The stylus performs well for highlighting and "selection" on devices. The nub is quite large, however, if you want to write anything finely, it really isn't designed for that. Also, I bought this in the light blue and the pink (as a gift.) Within a week, the blue part of the stylus is very dingy and just looks filthy (and the stylus is stored inside the iPad case in the "binding.") The "dirt" doesn't affect performance, but I'd recommend a dark color if you're buying.
customer_reviews.author: Flyer

customer_reviews.title: Great stylus but the pen tip is an actual ink pen.
customer_reviews.text: I thought this was a stylus with a pen tip that was a felt nib or something similar. I have a Wacom tablet and I really enjoy the felt nibs. I was looking for a similar experience on my ipad. When I received the stylus I was a little disappointed that the pen tip was an actual ink pen. Apparently you can get nibs but you must purchase them separately. Other than that it is a great stylus and I will be ordering the nib to try with the ipad.
customer_reviews.author: Tyson

customer_reviews.title: Dud item, excellent service
customer_reviews.text: The item was advertised as a Wacom Stylus Bamboo Pen Duo. What I got was a similar looking counterfeit product. The item I bought was "fulfilled by Amazon", but sold by "H&K Electronics Outlet". I figured out that I had a dud by googling for it online. I notified Amazon of the issue. They refunded my purchase and sent me a pre-paid shipping label to send back the counterfeit. 0 stars for the seller, 3 stars for the counterfeit (honestly, it was pretty high quality), and 5 stars for Amazon's amazing customer service.
customer_reviews.author: d2

customer_reviews.title: Bamboo stylus
customer_reviews.text: I have and IPhone and longish fingernails, not a good match, so I am constantly on the lookout for a stylus that I like. I like this one. It is light and doesn't take up much room. I have a cover on my phone, so I cannot attach it, which is what I really wanted to do, but I like it nonetheless, and I have not lost it yet, which is a testament to its value in my life.
customer_reviews.author: Virginia

customer_reviews.title: So So
customer_reviews.text: I take notes on my iPad and I needed a stylus. I bought this stylus based on some reviews on the net and the Bamboo brand image. It worked OK....the tip is a little broad and after a while the coating wore off the tip making it hard to write on the screen. I stopped using it and bought an Adonit Jot Touch 4 instead.
customer_reviews.author: Paul D.

customer_reviews.title: It's okay
customer_reviews.text: The weight and balance are nice and the nibs work well on tablet and phone. However, the top silver part came off easily and it doesn't go back on very tightly; nor does it stay permanently with crazy glue.The green color up near the pocket clip is wearing thin. Basically, it WORKS fine, but in the short time I've had it it's come to look like a piece of junk. I have pens that I have spent way less on that hold up better.
customer_reviews.author: M. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Very functional Stylus!
customer_reviews.text: I didn't exactly know what I was buying with the Duo set which included a regular pen. I thought the pen could also be used on my ipad but it is strictly for writing. In hindsight I would buy just the stylus the next time because I don't like the fact that the stylus is exposed or the pen is exposed since there is only one cap. The nib on the stylus could easily get torn or mis-shapened in my purse if it's not covered.
customer_reviews.author: GreenLady

customer_reviews.title: Good stylus
customer_reviews.text: I like this stylus for writing, playing games and sketching (i'm not much of an artist but I dabble in doodles) on the iPad mini. I also like having it so my grubby snacking fingers don't dirty up my iPad's screen when watching movies and browsing the web. It's held up pretty well so far, I wish it had a cap for the nub so I wasn't worried about it getting damaged in my bad but the product itself performs well.
customer_reviews.author: Terri Ann

customer_reviews.title: Great Pen
customer_reviews.text: Let face it, a stylist pen is nothing more than an ink pen with a rubber tip on the other end to assist us with our electronic screens. Mind you, the corporations have stuck together, and over inflated the price. I was so glad to see Bamboo come out with a pen that the rubber tip can be replaced vs. buying a whole new pen. Bamboo has my business from now on. The other companies are greedy and take advantage. Thank you Bamboo
customer_reviews.author: Michael Small

customer_reviews.title: Good Stylus, not Great
customer_reviews.text: It is a high quality stylus. I purchased this based on other people's reviews. It feels nice, I like the materials. It is a little heavy, and the weight will be noticeable over time. I purchased the Duo thinking the pen would come in handy at some point... wrong. I should have just purchased the stylus. I gave it 4 stars and not 5 because of the weight and price. Doesnt function as well as your finger, but good enough that you wont regret using it.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Calvo

customer_reviews.title: Best stylus on the market for iPhone 5
customer_reviews.text: I love the Wacom Bamboo Stylus. Of all of the styluses I have bought for my iPhone, it is clearly my favorite. The pen, as received from the factory, comes equipped with the "soft" nib, "firm" nibs are available in a package of 3. I must have purchase 4 or 5 different styluses for my iPhone, but the Wacom Bamboo I feel is the best out there. The Duo model comes with a pen as a part of the stylus.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Falls apart after two months of using it
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in July two months later here is what has happened. Day one I lost then found it in my yard. Why? Because the cap is so loose it falls off, this has just gotten worse. Now this week the pen when writing becomes loose and crooked then falls out of the pen housing. It looks nice but it is just a terrible product. FYI I tried to return it and they won't let me outside of a month from the purchase date.
customer_reviews.author: Jabisout

customer_reviews.title: User friendly!
customer_reviews.text: I love this stylus because it attaches to my iPad's headphone jack. I do wish that the cap fit snugly to the end of the stylus like a pen cap does in case you wish to use the headphone jack. I find that the stylus works well on the screen, and I use it with students with special needs and the are able to use it easily as well.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle Robinson

customer_reviews.title: It's okay
customer_reviews.text: The tip is a little too soft and the pen cap fits very loosely. The pen separates from the cap very often when I put it in my coat pocket. the pen is fine, but not the best ink I've used. The replaceable tip is a nice plus, but it seams to loosen up quite a bit. I tried to really tighten it and I tore the rubber tip. I would suggest buying replacement tips right away and I would also suggest the firmer tips.
customer_reviews.author: Mark R

customer_reviews.title: Much better than all the others I tried
customer_reviews.text: I like to use penultimate to take my notes in hand writing on my iPad, this works much better I can actually write legibly even with my crummy strawl. Plus it's very helpful to have the pen on the other side when I have to write on paper. It also doesn't look nearly as goofy as many of the others. It is not the cheapest, but I find that when I pay a little bit more money for something like this I actually don't lose it.
customer_reviews.author: RV

customer_reviews.title: I love Wacom's products
customer_reviews.text: I own several WACOM products, including the Cintiq Companion as well as a regular Bamboo drawing pad. I love Wacom's products, everything works very well and has a great feel to it.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Attenborough

customer_reviews.title: Good Expandable stylus for  MY KINDLE.
customer_reviews.text: I especially like this stylus, because it works well when I have to type on my kindle. I have very long strong nails, So when I type for whatever reasons on my kindle, my fingers always missed the wrong letters. using my stylus pen as I call it. works wells for that purpose.I hit the right letter everytime try it you might like it. works for me.
customer_reviews.author: dogmae

customer_reviews.title: Good for drawing, bad for writing
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice stylus, but it a little lightweight if you want something more substantial. Is also easily lost because it is so small. I like it and it does the job but I wanted to use it primarily for taking handwritten notes on my ipad. It works decently, but it makes my handwriting look horrible. It does a really nice job if you're using a drawing or other artwork application. But other than that, this stylus does what it says it should do.
customer_reviews.author: Knoxgrad

customer_reviews.title: Love this stylus
customer_reviews.text: Have read reviews and tried out two other brands but this stylus wins hands down. It is a nice size and good weight and has a smaller than average tip, which is the main reason I bought it. A big plus is the fact that you can buy replacement tips. If you play games with a stylus and you're trying to beat the clock, you can blow out a tip cause you're constantly hitting the screen too hard. Great to be able to replace the tip instead of buying a new stylus.
customer_reviews.author: Bobbie E. Griffin

customer_reviews.title: Very handy stylus.
customer_reviews.text: Stylus is very handy and I have gotten compliments on the headphone clip to keep it attached to my tablet. The rubber tip seems extra hard and I've had some instances where it doesn't have the best screen contact. I may have to order new tips. Otherwise, a fairly good product for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Gene M.

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: It works great which I expected. Has a hefty feel quality feel. The tip was not as small as I had hoped and changing the tip is an exercise in patience. Hope a smaller, more precise tip can be made available for it. I would recommend the soft tips over the firm as they seem to require more pressure for devices to react to input. Excellent product over all and recommend it to everyone.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Montana

customer_reviews.title: Good pen, but does not last long
customer_reviews.text: This is a very good pen and stylus. In terms of weight and responsiveness I prefer it over the others I've tried. However, the nib does not last long, and the replacements are expensive. I did prefer the hard ones to the soft ones. After 4 months of usage, the nib section of the pen completely disconnected from the rest of the pen. Now I only have an average pen with a hole on the back, so I would not buy again.
customer_reviews.author: ps

customer_reviews.title: Disposable stylus?
customer_reviews.text: The stylus works, but after a few DAYS the tip has lost its sturdiness and is too soft, which requires a much bigger pressure to make it work. There are many reports of tips breaking down after just a few days of use. I contacted the company, did not receive a reply. Too bad! UPDATE 5-10-2012 The company finally replied to my requests and sent one replacement tip. Hence I am increasing the rating by one star. I remain convinced that the tip should last much longer than a few weeks. Other stylus pens I have tried do not have this problem.
customer_reviews.author: Gianfri

customer_reviews.title: still looking for a great stylus
customer_reviews.text: While this stylus is a good size and well made I found its performance to be very uneven. I bought it for use with my Kindle Fire HD. One moment it would work fine, the next there would be no response. Then, and most frustrating of all, it would respond with far to much sensitivity. As I said, very uneven performance and I'm back to using my trusty finger!
customer_reviews.author: Derek D Jones

customer_reviews.title: didn't get the hype
customer_reviews.text: I read several reviews that said this was the best stylus for a tablet but I can't tell the difference from the one I bought for $9.99. It has the soft, rubbery nib but I really hoped for a finer tip on the opposite end. I saw two distinct ends on the pen in the picture so thought one was wide and the other narrow. Wrong - the other end is a real pen! Don't quite get that but am using the stylus end.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy A. Ferrell

customer_reviews.title: Amazing stylus
customer_reviews.text: Yes, this stylus is pricey, but if you are looking for a solid pen like feel stylus, Bamboo is the only way to go. I tried a bunch of different ones from the cheap $5 ones to other $30 ones. One day my friend wanted to show me his new ipad and he brought it over along with the bamboos stylus. The second i started writing with this pen, i knew i found my perfect one. It's got a perfect weight to it, solid build and the tip is very small. 5/5 stars for this great product.
customer_reviews.author: AG

customer_reviews.title: Best iPad stylus of dozen I have tried
customer_reviews.text: Much better than the cheap generic stylus - tip is smaller and more precise. Easier to write with than most, and much better than the TruGlide Pro Precision Stylus (more precise, easier to write with) at a lower cost. This is the one I carry every day, and I have a drawer full of other stylus that range in cost from 1/10th the price to double the price, but just are not as usable.
customer_reviews.author: B. Rutledge

customer_reviews.title: Does not stay open.
customer_reviews.text: This stylus has the regular rubber tip any other much less expensive stylus has. I wanted it for its compact size so I could fit it in my small waist bag, but the other reviewer was correct when saying it DOES NOT stay open when you are writing with it. This is frustrating. I would not recommend it for this reason.
customer_reviews.author: LindaDF

customer_reviews.title: Inferior product from Wacom
customer_reviews.text: Garbage! Poor tracking and frequent loss of pointer. Bought two and tested in iPad Mini 2, Nexus 7, Samsung Galaxy S5, Nexus 6P, and Moto E. Same results across the board. Surprisingly, my cheap $1.99 5-pack Chinese stylus worked better. I'm disappointed in Wacom quality.
customer_reviews.author: 杨杰夫

customer_reviews.title: Fake Wacom Product.  Do not BUY!
customer_reviews.text: The cap on this stylus did not fit properly so I contacted Wacom directly thinking they could just send out a set of new o-rings as I thought that would cure the problem. After speaking to their customer service people I was told what I had was a knock off (fake). I can see how the supplier could have been fooled as if the cap would have fit..... I would have never known
customer_reviews.author: Frank R.

customer_reviews.title: No better than a cheapo stylus
customer_reviews.text: I read the positive reviews on this and was hopeful. Unfortunately, this thing wasn't any better than a cheap chinese 3-pack on amazon. If I wrote at an angle, nothing appeared on the screen. I had to push down and hold completely vertical for it to write. It looks fancy, is good quality, but didn't write well.
customer_reviews.author: Prettyinpink

customer_reviews.title: The nib comes off!!
customer_reviews.text: The pen was awesome to use on my iPad for school, but after a few weeks the tip started to rip off. I am someone who takes care of my things, and I can tell you that it was not because of rough usage. I don't know what the tip is made out of but it isn't working. It's unfortunate that I have to actually be extremely careful when using it now so the small rip won't widen. Overall the pen feels good, but the nib must be made out of a better durable material.
customer_reviews.author: I. Estevez

customer_reviews.title: Good weight and length. Looks great too.
customer_reviews.text: For those looking for a pen and stylus combo, Wacom's Bamboo Duo is one of the best out there. As with any capacitive stylus you'd still feel like you're writing with an unsharpened crayon since the technology forces a "fat" end to work with the screens. But this particular stylus has great weight and length that feels like a premium pen. The look promotes a premium feel that wouldn't feel out of place in the pocket of a professional.
customer_reviews.author: Ger

customer_reviews.title: Good Product
customer_reviews.text: This stylus is worth the money. Looks great and the build quality is superb. The smaller tip is definitely nicer than others I've seen. However, for more delicate tasks like drawing, it may not be as responsive as people require. Aside from that it has never been unresponsive and worked every time. And yes it does work on android tablets and phones if you're unsure, I have an Asus Transformer Pad 300 and HTC One S.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Stokes

customer_reviews.title: NIce product!
customer_reviews.text: While I did not want to have a tablet that required a stylus, I still wanted a tablet that was more than just a 'time suck'. So while I have been using the iPad for various uses just having it for writing down notes, etc was less than friendly. I am not a graphic artist; I just wanted to use the iPad for note writing. I tried several styluses and the Bamboo really does work as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth R. Wortley

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: This stylus flows so smoothly across my iPad. I use my iPad for taking notes in all of my classes, most of my classes are math and chemistry so I'm drawing a lot in my notes and need to write quickly. I have used a few styluses before that stick as you try to write which really slows you down. Also, the nibs inevitably get worn down after so much use, replacing an entire stylus is a pain, so the replaceable nibs are amazing!
customer_reviews.author: Jasmine M.

customer_reviews.title: Love the length and color
customer_reviews.text: I already have the pink stylus and wanted another for my purse to carry with me. My only disappointment is that the blue one doesn't have the easy grip coating of the pink one. I assumed they all had the same feel. It's still a very nice stylus. I play a lot of sudoku on my phone so it's good to order the extra set of stylus nibs.
customer_reviews.author: Maggie

customer_reviews.title: This product it good but it can be better
customer_reviews.text: This product it good but it can be better. My biggest issue is its tip. While it's works relatively well when drawing (the main reason I bough said product) there are times when is it isn't totally responsive. On the flip side this is a product of terrific build and style. It feels great in your hand, the retractable nature of it is supercool, and I like the headphone jack attachment. So if you can get over the poor quality and the price remains reasonable (I bought mine for less than 10) I would recommend the small investment.
customer_reviews.author: E. M. Ramie

customer_reviews.title: Nice stylus for iPad, bit expensive
customer_reviews.text: I tried several stylus for the iPad, and found this to be the best for writing and general use of the ipad (tapping, swiping, etc). There may be better ones out there for drawing, but I think this one has the best balance of a soft feel yet firm enough which is necessary for writing. It's a little expensive, so I'm giving it a 4 star.
customer_reviews.author: Alejandro

customer_reviews.title: Works OK, butsuggest you pay more for a newer generation device
customer_reviews.text: It works for it's purpose of navigating a phone or tablet but the tip is fatter thsn newer more expensive versions.
customer_reviews.author: MarcR

customer_reviews.title: Great for me
customer_reviews.text: Got this last week and for what it cost it is worth it,I have used it with my iPhone and it is ok when I text but it won't open apps I have to use my finger but if ok
customer_reviews.author: Hwilli79997

customer_reviews.title: Poor Design
customer_reviews.text: The first time my daughter used this product on the Kindle Fire, it left a scratch mark on the screen protector. Thank goodness for the protective film. Still, I am not happy that the rim (right above the cushioned tip) can scratch the when pull along the surface. At first, I did not believe her; but I tried the same pen stroke on another tablet and sure enough that it left a scratch#$%#$. I do not recommend this product for children use and be sure not to drag the pen across the screen (which will be difficult for left handed users).
customer_reviews.author: rich

customer_reviews.title: My Wife Loves it! But the nibs go fast
customer_reviews.text: My wife has been using this stylus for drawing on her iPad for over a year and absolutely loves it. The only issue is that the nibs crack pretty fast. They are cheap to replace, and can be ordered from both Wacom's website and Amazon, but still. It's not a big issue, just an inconvenience.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry Glonek

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply made for such a high price.
customer_reviews.text: I have had this in my possession for all of a day. The stylus is nice. However the pen part has already broken where it screws into the body of the pen. I can literally pull it out as though there is no threading there at all. Not to mention now when using the stylus that part is wobbly. I expect more from a company that has such a reputation.
customer_reviews.author: Rube4

customer_reviews.title: Love the device, but don't like the casing
customer_reviews.text: It took me a long time to make this purchase but I finally did it. I love the Stylus for the iPad, and I love how the pen writes. But the cap continually falls off, whether it's stationary or I am putting it on the other end while using it. And since the cap is where the pen holder is, I can not hook it to my iPad case for transporting.
customer_reviews.author: D. N. Fox

customer_reviews.title: It is SO difficult to write! DONT RECOMMENT
customer_reviews.text: I highly recommend that if you use this pen for note taking or something else, please go ahead to buy an apple pencil or logi pen!
customer_reviews.author: Charlie

customer_reviews.title: Good stylus, lid doesn't stay on... I you put it in your pocket, you'll hate this
customer_reviews.text: I put my pen in my pocket, this has a lid with a clip. When I put this in my pocket the lid CONSTANTLY falls off. It just isn't tight enough and this is a breaker for me. I need my pen/stylus 5-8 times a day, so to not be able to use the clip is a breaker for my use. Nib is good, but considering the thing is likely to bust and be worthless in 4-8 months, it's not worth it's price.
customer_reviews.author: Dean

customer_reviews.title: Not exactly as pictured
customer_reviews.text: This stylus arrived without the clip on the side that is shown in the picture. I do have one of these that I bought from Wacom earlier (and paid a lot more for it) and this one is not exactly like it. I bought this one as a back-up. I wonder whether the lack of the clip is why it is cheaper here? I don't really need the clip, but really, Amazon shouldn't sell items that do not match the picture that accompanies it. Why not just say it is a second?
customer_reviews.author: Indybend

customer_reviews.title: Found the Stylus I've been looking for
customer_reviews.text: I love Bamboo Stylus. I bought the one with the pen and one that is just a stylus. The only negative thing about the pen is the cap won't stay on the nib side while using the pen. Too loose and easily lost. I love the stylus though and its feature that allows for the chainging of the nibs when they wear out - which hasn't happened for me yet. I still bought extras for when that day comes. This works very well on my iPhone and the new iPad. Perfect weight- I like that it is sturdy. Absolutely worth the money as you will never need another stylus. I tried many others and none compare to Bamboo's product(s).
customer_reviews.author: Jim Callahan

customer_reviews.title: plastic tip that feels like a pen
customer_reviews.text: I bought this thinking the tip was hard and non-rubbery, but it was the exact opposite. Still looking for something that has a hard, plastic tip that feels like a pen. These soft rubbery ones that seem to be the most common styli don't work on a glass screen the way I would write with a pen and paper
customer_reviews.author: SM

customer_reviews.title: Alright
customer_reviews.text: I needed this for mostly fun purposes on my new iPad Mini but the tip is kind of flimsy. It's a great product, I just thought the tip would be more stiff. I like that it expands but it doesn't lock so depending on how you use the stylus it will collapse back into itself if you push hard enough.
customer_reviews.author: Kara

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: It works great. However it is too thick for my needs.
customer_reviews.author: Lawrence

customer_reviews.title: fake?
customer_reviews.text: the stylus doesnt feel premium at all.. this stylus is rated to be one of the best in the market, but the product received gave the exact same experience as that of using a cheap $2 stylus. read the recent reviews on the surfacing of imitations, with pen caps loosely 'secured' with 2 rubber rings, and i believe i am one of the unlucky victims of this scam as well. the stylus is not always responsive on my Xperia Tablet Z, and is frustrating. pen ink does not flow smoothly as well. felt totally cheated from this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: daniel ting

customer_reviews.title: I would like to see about returning them and getting one that ...
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted this too work for what I needed it for, which is tapping the I-pad screen when using to place orders. It seems that this is not designed to use as a tool to type letters and #'s, but rather as a drawing tool. I would like to see about returning them and getting one that will suit our needs better. As for the service from this supplier, I will use them again, as the ship time and other products that I ordered were just fine! Thank you! Ed
customer_reviews.author: ceiling savior

customer_reviews.title: bamboo Duo Stylus rocks!!
customer_reviews.text: I've tried quite a few stylus for my IPAD and none have worked as well as the Bamboo Duo. The tip is a medium size and the tip is the best I have used so far as it glides along the glass even when it is a bit dirty from finger smudges. Other stylus tend to catch on the smudges and offer a poor feel when you're writing or drawing. Love the pen as well...
customer_reviews.author: StraightTalk

customer_reviews.title: Still a fraud
customer_reviews.text: I previously had a bamboo duo and was bummed when it escaped my bag earlier this week. Since I take notes on my tablet I expedited a replacement sold by countrysaver and fulfilled by amazon. What I received today was a clear, poor quality knock off. There are videos online showing the difference, but I knew I was boned when the loose cap wouldn't stay in place and the cheap rubber tip pulled off without unscrewing any metal. I give 5 stars to the duo, it's a fantastic stylus. However until amazon gets their act together DO NOT buy here, especially from countrysaver. The marketplace is littered with knock offs like the one I got.
customer_reviews.author: Stewart U

customer_reviews.title: This is my daily use writing instrument
customer_reviews.text: If you have a tablet and are contemplating a stylus, get this one since it's a 2 in 1 tool that saves time and space. The pen is a hi quality ballpoint and the stylus is also a high quality soft rubber tip. Works great on my iPad mini for everything from handwriting apps to painting apps etc... Worth every penny and possibly more!
customer_reviews.author: Rolff

customer_reviews.title: Works fine on an iPad Air and nexus 7
customer_reviews.text: Works well, came quickly. Works fine on an iPad Air and nexus 7. Doesn't work very will with a glass screen protector, I have one on my iPhone 6. This isn't a ding against the stylus, just an FYI incase you have a glass screen protector on your device.
customer_reviews.author: dinnercoffee

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't register with a light touch
customer_reviews.text: The build quality is nice, but the main problem is that the tip doesn't register a touch on the screen when you use it lightly. I find that you have to put more pressure than needed on the tip for it to work. As a result I had to tap a button a few times to press it. Or when writing/drawing it would skips some parts of a continuous line I was drawing.
customer_reviews.author: Ali Sh.

customer_reviews.title: Cool bamboo Pen
customer_reviews.text: Works great with my iphone and iPad. Had it for a year and I never saw a lag or any other problem. Try to always keep your device screen clean and you will never have a problem. Many people complain of issues with this pen, but I think most of the time is due to greasy and/or dirty screens. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Maximus

customer_reviews.title: Lost my first and came back for seconds....
customer_reviews.text: I had purchased a Bamboo Solo Stylus previously (but in pink last time). My husband freaked out about the cost but when he saw it, he was very jealous. When I lost my pink one, I tried settling for a lesser quality one. It took me 2 days to buy another Bamboo. And, as the saying goes, if you want to find something, replace it! After 6 months, I found my pink one and now have 2 =)
customer_reviews.author: Corry Jankowski

customer_reviews.title: Great pen
customer_reviews.text: It's very responsive and I'm able to draw neat and precise lines, my only quorum is the nib is big. When trying to do fine lines it takes a little while to get use to where on the nib it's actually choosing to draw from. This is easily fixed by zooming in however for digital painting for me, it's a bit cumbersome however for the price, it's better than I had hoped.
customer_reviews.author: Robb

customer_reviews.title: Very nice
customer_reviews.text: The tip is very nice. It glides across the glass easily, and makes accurate marking easy. To be honest, as I got more used to my smartphone and tablet, I stopped needing a stylus, so I don't really use it much anymore. But of the several I tried, this was the best.
customer_reviews.author: Scott A

customer_reviews.title: Meh.
customer_reviews.text: Not sure if it's because of the surface protector I have on my iPhone 6+, but I have to push down quite hard on this in order to get the iPhone to register the stylus. So it's sitting in a box now. Will likely sell it at the spring yard sale.
customer_reviews.author: Kellie Peterson

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't read well on iOS devices
customer_reviews.text: I got this to use it with my iPhone or iPad, but it doesn't register well on iOS devices at all (you have to press much harder than is natural). I let a few friends at work try and all of them agreed on their iPad it wasn't really usable... but it seems to work fine on Android devices.
customer_reviews.author: Isaac Fowler

product_meta.title: Bamboo Duo Stylus + Pen for iPad (CS110K) [Old Version]
product_meta.description: Color:Black| Style:DuoBamboo Stylus duo is a dual-purpose stylus for iPad and Android tablets that combines a responsive, smooth pen tip for tablets at one end with a premium ball-point ink pen at the opposite end. This allows you to switch between working on a tablet and working on paper by simply flipping over the pen. One end features a smooth, best-in-class responsive pen tip for use on-screen, while the other end houses a high-quality inking pen for writing and drawing on paper. The pen cap can be attached conveniently to either end of the pen to protect the unused tip. The writing tip uses standard ink refills and delivers a writing sensation similar to regular ballpoint pens. With an elegant design, a satin-textured metal body, and quality craftmanship synonymous with all Wacom products, Bamboo Stylus duo is the ideal tool for writing, drawing or doodling in both a digital and analog world.
feature_bullets: Exchangeable responsive smooth nib/ pen tip for best pen-on-screen feeling; Weight-balanced design to feel right in your hand
Great experiences to use with iPad or iPhone, or Bamboo or most other tablets and mobile phones with a touch screen for sketching, drawing or writing
Polished anodized-aluminum body and Soft-touch finish, offers an attractive look and enables a comfortable hold
Soft rubber rings for a smooth fit of the cap on both tip ends
Doubles as a ball-point Pen for writing capability on paper
Offers a premium, pen-like experience for notetaking, sketching, drawing, and other forms of creative expression
Elegant, high end design - milled brushed aluminum, with replaceable nibs
Ergonomic with optimal in-hand weight and balance
Replaceable rubber tips and pen cartridges

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.2 out of 5 stars956 ratings4.2 out of 5 stars
